articles.title: ChatGPT To Debut Super Bowl Ad, Google Edits AI: Watch 42 Top Spots
articles.author: Martine Paris
articles.summary: This year's Super Bowl is being billed as the AI Super Bowl. ChatGPT-maker OpenAI will be making a Super Bowl debut with its first television commercial. Google is returning to the game to promote its large language model, Gemini. Meta is advertising its AI Ray-Bans, Salesforce is dining with AI, and GoDaddy is showing off its AI design features. Anthropic has decided to skip the Super Bowl this year, having debuted a mic drop ad last year.

articles.title: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IS SELF- REPLICATING
articles.author: Robin Westenra
articles.summary: For the first time, two AI systems have succeeded in self-replicating without human intervention. Llama-3.1-70B-Instruct, by Meta, and Qwen2.5-72B- instruct, by Alibaba, are less powerful than commercial AI systems, but both are widely used by developers. Meta's system has demonstrated the ability to self- replicate in 50% of cases and Alibaba's in 90%.

articles.title: Could Chatbots Be the Answer to Loneliness?
articles.summary: Loneliness is a significant public health issue. Peter Swain is an AI expert and futurist. He believes that chatbots can play a supportive role in helping people deal with loneliness. He also believes that AI is changing the game in mental health and has positive and negative effects.

articles.title: Would you use Google Gemini if it fills with ads?
articles.author: Eric Hal Schwartz
articles.summary: Google's AI chatbot Gemini doesn't have ads today, but the company is planning to introduce them in the future. Google has spent years fine-tuning the art of turning eyeballs into revenue. Google plans to spend $75 billion this year to keep up in the AI race.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Use of AI to Slash Education Spending Could Put Disabled Students at Risk
articles.author: Julia Métraux
articles.summary: Elon Musk's DOGE fed sensitive data into artificial intelligence software to decide which of the Department of Education's programs were wasteful and to slash its budget. The department plays a crucial role in making sure disabled kids receive the same access to education across states and distributes funding for the needed accommodations.

articles.title: Retroviral and by COB's collaboration launches the 'Retroviral Ai Lab'
articles.summary: An AI R&D lab designed for South African brands and agencies has been launched by Retroviral in collaboration with by COB. It offers generative AI, GPT development and TikTok engagement capabilities. It is spearheaded by Garth Manthé, a visionary AI specialist who has spent the last 12 months honing his AI expertise. His AI-driven spec ads have garnered over 15 million+ unique views on LinkedIn.

articles.title: Meta's AI transparency effort introduces ad content labels
articles.author: Karabo Ledwaba
articles.summary: Meta has implemented new AI labeling features to inform users when ads have been created or significantly altered using its in-house generative AI tools. According to a 2024 eMarketer survey, 61.3% of US consumers think media publications should always disclose when content is created by AI. A study from Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism and YouGov says 49% of adults worldwide want AI disclosure labels when it is used to create a new content image.

articles.title: 'Dangerous proposition': Top scientists warn of out-of-control AI
articles.author: Arjun Kharpal
articles.summary: Max Tegmark and Yoshua Bengio are concerned about the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI). They believe AGI could be dangerous as its creators might lose control of the system. They believe the key lies in so-called "tool AI" - systems created for a specific, narrowly-defined purpose.

articles.title: OpenAI cofounder John Schulman is joining Mira Murati's startup after brief stint at Anthropic
articles.author: Sharon Goldman
articles.summary: John Schulman is joining Mira Murati's new startup. He left Anthropic just five months after joining. Murati left OpenAI in September 2024. She was in talks to raise over $100 million in funding for the startup. The startup has already made headlines for poaching employees from OpenAI, Character AI and Google DeepMind.

articles.title: VSU tech talk brings AI and innovation into focus
articles.author: VALDOSTA
articles.summary: Dr. Kirk Borne is a world-renowned expert in data science and artificial intelligence (AI). He gave a talk at Valdosta State University's Health Science and Business Administration Building on Wednesday evening. He talked about how AI and big data are shaking up industries and creating new opportunities in entrepreneurship. Borne also talked about the AI hype cycle and its negative side.

articles.title: Searsport rowboat company to be featured in Super Bowl ad
articles.author: Matt Junker
articles.summary: Lynn Cottrell got a call from a production company in Los Angeles offering to feature her family's business, Cottrel Boatbuilding, in a Super Bowl ad for Google's '50 States, 50 Stories' campaign. The campaign focuses on how small businesses are using Google AI technology to help support and grow their operations. The Maine-focused ad is already online. It features Lynn's husband, Dale, and two of their sons, Ben and Seth, who all work at the business together. The team filmed them rowing in one of their boats.

articles.title: Amazon to unveil major AI upgrade for Alexa at February 26 event
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Amazon is set to unveil a new version of its Alexa voice assistant at an event in New York on February 26th. It will be powered by generative AI. Dr. Anya Sharma, a leading AI researcher at Amazon Devices, explains the potential impact of this technology on Alexa.

articles.title: How psychologists kick-started AI by studying the human mind
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: As the science of the mind, psychology has played a pivotal role in shaping artificial intelligence. It opens up the possibility of a scientific understanding of intelligence, as important to psychology and neurophysiology as Newton's concepts were to physics. It's important to understand human intelligence.

articles.title: OpenAI taps TX for data center, eyes 16 other states as global competition heats up
articles.author: Javier E. David
articles.summary: OpenAI is expanding its push to construct data centers as a data center for artificial intelligence. The Abilene, Texas site is seen as the linchpin of a massive infrastructure buildout, adding to the Dallas-Fort Worth area's economic momentum. ChatGPT technology maker is weighing at least 16 future locations that are expected to flourish across the country, including Arizona, California, New York, Pennsylvania and Utah.

articles.title: Bill Gates: ‘We Will Not Need Humans for Most Things'
articles.author: The Liberty Beacon
articles.summary: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates gloats that humans will soon have little use for human beings thanks to advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) technology and will not want to watch computers play baseball anymore.      .   "We won't wanna watch computer games any more"

articles.title: ChatGPT Search Is Now Free to Use Without an Account
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: ChatGPT search has been free since November 30, 2022, but you needed an OpenAI account to use it. As of February 5, 2025, you can ditch the account and just click the link and type your queries. Media companies partnered with OpenAI include Associated Press, Reuters, Vox Media, The Atlantic, Hearst, Dotdash Meredith, Time, and more.

articles.title: Boston Dynamics Parnters with Its Former CEO to Build a Humanoid Robot
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: Raibert founded Boston Dynamics in 1992 after spinning it off from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Last year, Raibert worked with Boston Dynamics to develop a reinforcement learning kit for Spot. Now, the research institute will focus on enhancing Atlas' capabilities with a project that will emphasize areas like the manipulation of objects and fixtures and explore full-body contact strategies that require coordination between arms and legs.

articles.title: OpenAI picks Texas for ‘flagship' data center in Stargate project
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI said on Thursday that Texas will be the 'flagship' data center site in the Stargate project it is building with SoftBank. Around 16 states have indicated interest in building data centers for Stargate. Stargate plans to invest up to $500 billion to help the United States stay ahead of China and other competitors in the global AI race.

articles.title: Catholic International University launches new program in AI, emerging technologies
articles.author: Catholic International
articles.summary: Catholic International University (CIU) is launching a master's degree program in the prudential design of emerging technologies. The program is designed to teach graduates how to integrate Christian principles into the design of artificial intelligence. Pope Francis has spoken frequently about potential challenges the Church sees with AI. The new degree is part of a new 'emerging technologies' department at CIU. The department brings together technology and theology.

articles.title: Accused creator of racist AI recording of Baltimore's Pikesville principal indicted on sex exploitation charges
articles.author: The Brunswick News
articles.summary: The man accused of using artificial intelligence to create a racist is in Baltimore. He is accused of creating a racist programme using AI. He denies the charge.   Â      in a statement by the Baltimore Police Department, which is investigating the matter.

articles.title: OpenAI considering 16 states for data center campuses as part of Trump's Stargate project
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: OpenAI is considering building data center campuses in 16 states. The company sent a request for proposals to states less than a week ago. President Trump introduced Stargate, a joint venture between OpenAI, Oracle and SoftBank to bolster U.S. artificial intelligence infrastructure. Stargate's first data center in Abilene, Texas, is currently being built.

articles.title: OpenAI's $500B Stargate Project eyeing Utah as potential investment target
articles.author: Art Raymond
articles.summary: Stargate Project is a privately funded effort to invest $500 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the U.S. over the next four years. The first Stargate data center campus is already under construction near Abilene, Texas. Utah is on the list of future data center buildout sites 'under active consideration' by OpenAI.

articles.title: OpenAI visits Oregon while scouting data center sites
articles.author: bamaap
articles.summary: OpenAI wants to build data centers to power its artificial intelligence technology in 16 states. The lead site will be in Texas, but the company is also looking for locations in Oregon, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. President Donald Trump championed the Stargate project championed by OpenAI, Oracle and Softbank, which is investing $100 billion and eventually up to $500 billion.

articles.title: Palantir Wins Dresner Advisory Services 2024 Application Innovation and Technology Innovation Awards in Multiple Categories
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. has been recognized as a winner in 9 categories of the Dresner Advisory Services 2024 Technology Innovation Awards and 2024 Application Innovation Awards. Palantir is a leading provider of AI systems and a leader in the field of machine learning.

articles.title: Turns out, it's not that hard to do what OpenAI does for less
articles.author: Andrew Tarantola
articles.summary: OpenAI's AI research claims that the only path to AGI lies through massive financial and energy expenditures. Independent researchers are using open-source technologies to match the performance of OpenAI's most powerful AI models and do so at a fraction of the price. Last Friday, a team from Stanford University and the University of Washington trained a math and coding-focused large language model that performs as well as Open AI's o1 and DeepSeek's R1 reasoning models for $50 in cloud compute credits. On Tuesday, researchers from Hugging Face released a competitor to the Deep Research and Google Gemini's tools, dubbed Open Deep Research, which they developed in just 24 hours.

articles.title: Why Palantir Technologies Stock Popped (Again) on Thursday
articles.author: Danny Vena
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) stock is up 7.9% as of 3:23 p.m. ET on Thursday. The company's fourth-quarter report after the market close on Monday caught many investors by surprise. Since then, Wall Street has been scrambling to update its models, which resulted in a raft of upgrades and price target increases.

articles.title: Businesses unprepared for AI-driven cyber threats, study warns
articles.author: The News International
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) reshapes the cybersecurity landscape, organisations worldwide face mounting challenges in defending their cybersecurity.    i.e. the representational image of artificial intelligence and the cybersecurity is on Unsplash/File. i.a/Unsplash

articles.title: OpenAI flagship Texas data center being built, new locations sought across US
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: OpenAI is looking for sites to build a network of huge data centers to power its artificial intelligence technology. The company is looking across 16 states to accelerate the Stargate project championed by President Donald Trump. The first project in Abilene, Texas, has been under construction for months.

articles.title: This AI is as good as ChatGPT o1, and it was built for under $50
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: DeepSeek R1's developers said they could train an open-source reasoning AI as good as ChatGPT o1 at a fraction of the cost.    Last week, anyone could create powerful AI models with the right combination of data and training.

articles.title: OpenAI looks to build 5 to 10 data centers through Stargate
articles.author: Evan Robinson-Johnson
articles.summary: Pennsylvania officials are working with OpenAI to build data centers in the commonwealth as part of its $500 billion Stargate project. The company is looking for at least 1 gigawatt of power at centers built in Texas and as many as 15 other states. OpenAI plans to make its first site announcements later this spring.

articles.title: OpenAI says to host some customers' data in Europe
articles.author: AFP News
articles.summary: ChatGPT developer OpenAI will allow some European customers to store and process data from conversations with its chatbots within the European Union, rather than on its infrastructure in the United States or elsewhere. The move underscores the impact of EU regulations on what major digital platforms, including artificial intelligence developers, can do with data originating from the bloc. German authorities announced Thursday that OpenAI would open its first office in the country, in Munich.

articles.title: Google Search testing 'AI Mode'
articles.author: Barry Schwartz
articles.summary: Google is testing a new search feature named 'AI Mode' for open-ended and exploratory questions. This includes queries that ask Google Search for advice and comparisons and exchanges that allow for follow-up questions. AI Mode might be coming to the Google Search apps and maybe directly to Google Search.

articles.title: University of Phoenix Leadership Appointed Vice Chair of Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs Task Team on Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Hal D. Morgan, MBA, has been appointed Vice Chair for the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs' Task Team on artificial intelligence for one year. He will assist the Task Team in its mission to research and examine the emerging technology of AI and address the impact on higher education and accreditation.

articles.title: Meta Tests Streamlined Advantage+ Campaign Setup
articles.author: David Cohen
articles.summary: Meta introduced several updates to its Advantage+ suite of artificial intelligence-powered automated ad products. The company is testing a streamlined Advantage+ campaign setup that combines its separate ad flows, manual campaign setup, and Advantage+. to extend AI optimization to more campaigns and give advertisers more control. The Advantage+ shopping campaigns are being renamed to Advantage+ sales campaigns. The Opportunity Score tool in Ads Manager is being made more widely available.

articles.title: Three AI Agents Built On Blockchain To Transform Crypto, DeFi, Gaming
articles.author: Sandy Carter
articles.summary: Cainam Ventures is looking for an AI Agent to work in the crypto and blockchain industry. Cainam Ventures, GOAT Gaming, and Olas are three interesting projects pushing the boundaries with AI Agents built on the blockchain. An AI Agent is an autonomous software entity that uses artificial intelligence techniques to make decisions and perform tasks.

articles.title: OpenAI Eyeing More Data Centers in Texas, Other States for Stargate
articles.author: Shirin Ghaffary
articles.summary: Stargate is a joint venture from OpenAI, SoftBank Group Corp. and Oracle Corp. It plans to invest $100 billion immediately and $500 billion over the next four years in physical infrastructure to develop more advanced AI models. OpenAI is close to selecting additional sites for data center campuses in Texas and eyeing more projects in over a dozen other states. The data center projects are each expected to have around 1 gigawatt of capacity.

articles.title: Google's AI-generated Super Bowl cheese ad has some holes
articles.author: Ramishah Maruf
articles.summary: A previous version of Google's Super Bowl ad featuring a Wisconsin cheese market owner with AI-generated product descriptions was wrong. The company has updated the ad and removed the incorrect statistic. Google is in the middle of a push to incorporate its AI technology across its suite of products.

articles.title: Tesla Rival Figure AI Ends Collaboration With OpenAI After 'Major Breakthrough,' Says It Will Show 'Something No One Has Ever Seen On A Humanoid' In Next 30 Days
articles.author: Anan Ashraf
articles.summary: Figure AI is leaving its collaboration agreement with OpenAI following a'major breakthrough' on its in-house robot AI. Figure AI was launched in 2022 with the aim of developing humanoids to address labor shortages and reduce the number of workers in unsafe jobs. OpenAI and Figure announced a partnership in February last year to develop AI models for humanoid robots. Tesla is also developing a humanoid robot nicknamed Optimus.

articles.title: Top ideas for non-chip AI investments in 2025
articles.author: Brad Smith
articles.summary: Brett Winton is the chief futurist of Ark Invest. He recommends Palantir, Tesla and Tempus AI as leading AI investments. He believes the emergence of China's DeepSeek AI model could further accelerate the AI trade's growth and investment potential.

articles.title: OpenAI looks across US for sites to build its Trump-backed Stargate AI data centers
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: OpenAI is looking for sites to build a network of huge data centers to power its artificial intelligence technology. The company is looking across 16 states to accelerate the Stargate project championed by President Donald Trump. The first project in Abilene, Texas, has been under construction for months.

articles.title: OpenAI looks across US for sites to build its Trump-backed Stargate AI data centers
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: OpenAI is looking for sites to build a network of huge data centers to power its artificial intelligence technology. The maker of ChatGPT put out a request for proposals for land, electricity, engineers and architects this week. It is looking across 16 states to accelerate the Stargate project championed by President Donald Trump.

articles.title: OpenAI looks across US for sites to build its Trump-backed Stargate AI data centers
articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN
articles.summary: OpenAI is looking for sites to build a network of huge data centers to power its artificial intelligence technology. The company is looking across 16 states to accelerate the Stargate project championed by President Donald Trump. The first project in Abilene, Texas, has been under construction for months.

articles.title: Leading Tech Hiring Platform hackajob Launches The AI Collective to Assist Companies in Hiring Top-Tier AI Professionals
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: The AI Collective is an exclusive network of pre-vetted top AI talent that will allow companies to quickly hire top-tier experts with proven success in machine learning, data science and AI engineering. Hackajob is a leading U.S., U.K., and India tech hiring platform.

articles.title: 'AI powerhouse': White House encourages Americans to provide ideas for artificial intelligence strategy
articles.author: Brooke Singman
articles.summary: The White House is asking Americans to contribute policy ideas for the AI Action Plan by March 15. President Donald Trump signed an executive order at the end of January on artificial intelligence. The focus on AI was a campaign promise of the Trump administration. It is also a priority of the current administration.

articles.title: 'AI powerhouse': White House encourages Americans to provide ideas for artificial intelligence strategy
articles.author: Brooke Singman
articles.summary: The White House is opening its artificial intelligence plan up to Americans to contribute policy ideas to ensure that the United States is "the undeniable leader" in AI technology. President Donald Trump signed an executive order at the end of January on artificial intelligence. That order directed the development of an AI Action Plan. Americans can share their proposals on the Federal Register's website through the middle of March.

articles.title: AI expert joins Alibaba as VP
articles.author: Hong Kong Standard
articles.summary: Steven Hoi Chu-hong has joined Alibaba as group vice president. He will oversee Alibaba's AI foundational model focused on individual user use cases.       in mainland media reports.  in China.  In the U.S. it's called Alibaba Technologies.

articles.title: Joe Wright To Direct AI Thriller ‘Alignment' For Fifth Season And Makeready
articles.author: Alignment
articles.summary: Fifth Season landed the spec in one of 2024's bigger spec sales following a highly competitive bidding war. The story follows a cutting-edge tech company whose latest AI model begins manipulating global markets and stoking international conflict. Half a dozen directors were in the mix for the job, but Wright's take eventually won over producers.

articles.title: Why BigBear.ai, SoundHound AI, and AST SpaceMobile Shares All Popped This Week
articles.author: Bram Berkowitz
articles.summary: BigBear.ai, AST SpaceMobile and SoundHound AI have enjoyed strong weeks thanks to new economic data, falling Treasury yields, and company-specific events such as securing new business, analyst upgrades, and new product launches. Cantor Fitzgerald significantly hiked its price target from $3.50 to $8 and raised its revenue estimates for the full year of 2025 for BigBearai. BigBear entered into a warrant exercise agreement with an existing accredited investor to get gross proceeds of $21.9 million.

articles.title: Montgomery County Podcast "Consumer Connection" Tackles AI Scams and
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Montgomery County Office of Consumer Protection (OCP) has launched a podcast called "Unmasking AI's Role in Scams". The most recent episode is a dive into the treacheries of artificial intelligence and how it's crafting more cunning deceptions to part unwitting consumers from their data and dollars.

articles.title: Google has allegedly started internally testing an 'AI Mode' for Search
articles.author: Nickolas Diaz
articles.summary: Report claims Google is testing "AI Mode" in Search. The alternate mode in Search is displayed as a chat, reminiscent of talking with Gemini. It's said to be powered by a custom form of Google's Gemini 2.0 model. Google expanded its AI Overviews to over 100 countries a few months ago.

articles.title: AI's Impact on the Trump Mass Deportation Plan Will Be Significant and Controversial
articles.author: Steven Burg
articles.summary: The Department of Homeland Security announced that its fiscal year 2025 budget dedicates millions of dollars to AI. Trump promised that he would begin the largest deportation program in U.S. history focusing on criminals, drug dealers, and human traffickers who are in the country illegally. The Biden administration routinely used AI in immigration and deportation.

articles.title: Tanner Health Deploys Abridge Across Specialties With Focus on Transforming Behavioral Health Practice
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Tanner Health is implementing Abridge's AI platform for clinical conversations enterprise-wide. Tanner will focus on deploying Abridge rapidly to behavioral health practices in west Georgia and east Alabama. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content on this page.

articles.title: Google's Gemini Super Bowl ads push AI as a tool you can use every day
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Google debuted a pair of new Super Bowl commercials that portray AI as a technology that's as central to people's lives as the phone or computer they access it on. The first ad, titled 'Dream Job', depicts a man using the Gemini Live voice mode on his Pixel phone to prepare for a job interview. The next ad, called Party Blitz, takes on a much more lighthearted tone and focuses on the AI chatbot's voice mode.

articles.title: You No Longer Need an OpenAI Login to Use ChatGPT Search
articles.author: Samantha Kelly
articles.summary: ChatGPT's search function is now available for logged-out users for the first time. People can use natural language to ask for up-to-date sports scores, news, stock quotes and other information. The change is part of an effort to provide ChatGPT with more useful answers.

articles.title: Is the new AI-powered Alexa almost here? 6 things to know
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: It's been well more than a year since Amazon gave us a glimpse of a revamped Alexa, complete with an AI overhaul under the hood. Now there are signs that the AI-powered Alexa is almost ready for prime time and journalists are excited about it.

articles.title: OpenAI says to host some customers' data in Europe
articles.author: AFP
articles.summary: ChatGPT developer OpenAI will allow some European customers to store and process data from conversations with its chatbots within the European Union. The move underscores the impact of EU regulations on what major platforms, including artificial intelligence developers, can do with data originating from the bloc.

articles.title: How To Avoid A Premature AI Scale-Back In 2025
articles.author: Tomas Gorny
articles.summary: In the year ahead, businesses are likely to make a strategic mistake in how they handle AI, especially when it comes to advancing customer experiences. Forrester warns that businesses fixated on AI ROI will scale back prematurely. Businesses should focus on the real-world use cases rather than on the hype and focus on working with their partners.

articles.title: Exclusive: Model ML, a financial research startup automating Wall Street's grunt work, emerges from stealth
articles.author: Sage Lazzaro
articles.summary: Model ML is a new AI-powered workspace that automates financial research and due diligence on Wall Street. It was founded by brothers Chaz and Arnie Englander, serial entrepreneurs behind last-mile delivery company Fancy (acquired by Gopuff) and marketplace company Llama. The company announced a $12 million funding round led by Y Combinator and LocalGlobe.

articles.title: EU details which systems fall within AI Act's scope
articles.author: Natasha Lomas
articles.summary: The European Union has published guidance on what constitutes an AI system under its new AI Act. The Act came into force last summer. The first compliance deadline on banned use cases kicked in last weekend. The Commission's 13-page guidelines are likely to be closely parsed by companies.

articles.title: Backlash intensifies against AI tools used by candidates in job hunt
articles.author: Andy Medici
articles.summary: Artificial-intelligence company Anthropic discourages job candidates from using AI to apply for its jobs. There is a backlash against candidates using AI in their job application. Survey by Canva found 57% of job seekers have used AI tools to create their resume and 38% used them to search for job listings.

articles.title: AI tools increasingly discouraged by companies in job-hiring process
articles.summary: Anthropic discourages job candidates from using AI to apply for its jobs. Many companies are discouraging the use of AI to speed up the hiring process. Recruitment expert Matt Collingwood says there is a backlash against candidates using AI in their job applications.

articles.title: Google's Gemini rolls out ‘world's best' AI model, free of charge
articles.author: PC World
articles.summary: Google has given Gemini app access to a new AI model called Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking Experimental. Google is also releasing a version of the AI model that can interact with other Google apps, such as YouTube, Search, and Maps. The goal is for Gemini to further incorporate these apps to bolster its reasoning capabilities to help you do more.

articles.title: Google Makes Updated Gemini 2.0 AI Available To All
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Google has announced to make the updated Gemini 2.0 AI generally available. Google is in the race to build new and better artificial intelligence (AI) models and has announced that it will release the Gemini AI for general availability soon.

articles.title: Stanford and UW researchers build $50 open-source ChatGPT o1 rival
articles.author: Jai Hamid
articles.summary: Stanford and University of Washington researchers built an AI model called s1 for under $50 in cloud computing credits. The s1 model delivers performance on par with top-tier reasoning models, including OpenAI's o1 and DeepSeek's R1. The base model came from Qwen, the AI lab owned by Alibaba, and it was free to download.

articles.title: Academic researchers find a way to train an AI reasoning model for less than $50
articles.author: Bob Yirka
articles.summary: Stanford University and the University of Washington have found a way to train an AI reasoning model for a fraction of the price paid by big corporations that produce widely known products such as ChatGPT. The team used an off-the-shelf AI model made by Alibaba and trained it in 26 minutes using 16 Nvidia H100 GPUs.

articles.title: Academic researchers find a way to train an AI reasoning model for less than $50

The research team used an off-the-shelf AI model made by Alibaba, a China-owned company. They trained it in 26 minutes using 16 Nvidia H100 GPUs.

articles.title: ChatGPT May Lose Market Share to This New AI—and It's on Sale
articles.author: Stack Social
articles.summary: 1min.AI is an all-in-one AI tool. It's powered by the likes of GPT, Gemini, Llama, Midjourney and other premium models. You pay a one-time lifetime subscription ($39.99) for a monthly credit allowance. You get 1,000,000 monthly credits. You can earn up to 450,000 more by logging into the app daily.

articles.title: A paradigm shift? The view from China on DeepSeek and the global AI race
articles.author: Ni Tao
articles.summary: DeepSeek-R1 is an open-source AI assistant. It is available under an MIT license. It achieved ChatGPT-4o-level performance using 2,048 Nvidia H800 graphic processing units (GPUs). The firm claimed the training cost was only $5.576 million, a fraction of what OpenAI, Meta, Google, and Anthropic spent on their large language models (LLMs).

articles.title: OpenAI Set to Make Super Bowl Ad Debut
articles.author: Wall Street Journal
articles.summary: The TV spot marks the artificial-intelligence company's biggest foray into consumer advertising to date. It's called "Artificial Intelligence" and it's aimed at people using the Internet.      Â   i.e. people using AI.

articles.title: Why Amazon is Betting on ‘Automated Reasoning' to Reduce AI's Hallucinations
articles.author: Wall Street Journal
articles.summary: Amazon is using math to help solve one of artificial intelligence's most intractable problems: its tendency to make up answers and repeat them back to us with confidence. It's using it to solve the problem of AI's tendency to repeat answers with confidence, rather than with truth.

articles.title: Government outlines AI program plans
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: Taiwan was ranked No. 11 for having computing power of 103 petaflops as of Nov. 19 last year. The government wants to achieve 1,200 by 2029. It will intensify efforts to develop "Sovereign Artificial Intelligence [AI]".

articles.title: Top AI Company Anthropic Pleads With People Seeking Jobs There Not to Use AI for Job Applications
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: In today's labor market, prospective applicants are inundated with spam job offers, filtered by AI-powered HR bots, interviewed by large language models and forced to navigate job boards packed with ghost listings. Anthropic, OpenAI's chief competitor and the creator of Claude, forbids AI assistants during the application process.

articles.title: Why Using AI To Improve CX Is Challenging
articles.author: Megan Poinski
articles.summary: A new study from CX platform Nextiva found that 79% of companies see customer experience as a revenue driver, rather than a cost center, and 94% have seen at least some ROI on investments made in that area over the last five years. The study found using AI to further CX is a struggle. Google Cloud unit didn't bring in as much revenue as expected. Alphabet reported $96.4 billion in Q4 revenues (12% year-over-year growth) and $350 billion in annual revenues (14% increase over 2023).

articles.title: Researchers trained an OpenAI rival in half an hour for less than $50

articles.title: AI and scientists unite to decipher old scrolls charred by the Vesuvius volcano
articles.author: Jill Lawless
articles.summary: Scientists hope a mix of artificial intelligence and human expertise will help decipher ancient scrolls carbonized by a volcanic eruption 2,000 years ago. The scrolls were found in a cave in northern England. The cave was covered in volcanic ash.

articles.title: OpenAI looks across US for sites to build its Trump-backed Stargate AI data centers
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: OpenAI is looking for sites to build a network of huge data centers to power its artificial intelligence technology. The maker of ChatGPT put out a request for proposals for land, electricity, engineers and architects and began visiting locations in Oregon, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin this week.

articles.title: Penny's Wine Shop to appear in local Super Bowl commercial
articles.summary: Before the pandemic, Lance Lemon and his business partner Kristen Gardner Beal had plans to open a brick and mortar wine shop. With quarantine in effect, they shifted their business model online, creating RichWine, an online service which delivers wine to consumers across the state. They also partnered with local chefs to provide food for wine tasting events in the city, which inspired them to open Penny's Wine Shop in February 2023. On Sunday, an advertisement featuring Penny's will air during the local broadcast of the Super Bowl. The commercial is part of a '50 States, 50 Stories' campaign, which will highlight the impact that Google Gemini has had on 50 small businesses.

articles.title: THU AM News: AI expert says large language model development nearing plateau; Autism services group rebrands as Autism United of Wisconsin, splits from national Autism Society of America
articles.author: Alex Moe
articles.summary: Jeremy Kedziora, an AI specialist with the Milwaukee School of Engineering, predicts the growth of AI models like ChatGPT will soon hit a plateau. This means AI scientists will need to leverage the already maximized models better to do end-to-end tasks. In late 2024, a team of researchers created an AI model based on LLMs that can come up with ideas on its own, review literature, gather data, generate data, write the code to run them and write a study for a peer-reviewed journal.

articles.title: The most important person in Ely? Don't ask AI
articles.author: Catie Clark
articles.summary: ChatGPT picked Dorothy Molter as the most important person in Ely. Google's Gemini AI named the International Wolf Center as Ely's most prominent landmark. Microsoft's Copilot AI didn't understand the answer to a question about the most famous person from Ely. The definition of 'landmark' is summarised as an object or an unusual or aesthetically interesting structure.
